resources.string: Block app trackers on your device
One easy step for better app privacy

In 2021, we found that 70% of popular apps allow other companies to track your personal information, even when youâ€™re sleeping.\n\nSee which of your apps are on this list and take back control with Device Shield.

Device Shield blocks app trackers from other companies, like when Facebook attempts to track you in a banking app.\n\nIt\'s free, and you can enjoy your apps as your normally would. Working in the background, it helps protect you night and day.
Device Shield is not a VPN

However, your device will recognize it as one. This is because Device Shield uses a local â€™â€™VPN connectionâ€™â€™ to work. \n\nDevice Shield is different because it never sends your data to a server.
Device Shield shows a real-time summary of which apps allow other companies to track you.
You can access Device Shield in Settings.
Device Shield disabled.\nTap to continue blocking tracking attempts across your apps.
Device Shield is enabled and blocking tracking attempts across your apps.
Enable Device Shield for a summary
Success! ðŸŽ‰ You\â€™ve enabled Device Shield. Manage this feature in Settings.
Device Shield doesnâ€™t block trackers when apps require them to work properly. Consider limiting use of the following apps or viewing their content in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser instead.

Youâ€™ve probably heard about companies like Google and Facebook tracking you behind the scenes on third-party websites. But did you know they also track your personal information through apps on your device?

In 2021, DuckDuckGo found that over 70% of 100 of the top apps on Android contain trackers from major companies like Facebook, Google, and Amazon. Over 70% of those same apps send personal data to at least one of these companies, even when youâ€™re not using your device.

Trackers in apps may have access to a lot more information than their website tracker cousins, such as your location down to which floor of a building you're on, how often you play games while at work, and when and how long you sleep each day. Even if you havenâ€™t given apps explicit permission to collect data, they can still take it without your knowledge.

Tracking networks like Facebook and Google use these little pieces of information to build a digital profile about you. With it, tracking networks can manipulate what you see online and allow advertisers to bid on access to you based on your data.

Trackers in apps is a BIG problem for privacy. But DuckDuckGo has a solution that can help.

When enabled in the DuckDuckGo Privacy Browser app, Device Shield blocks many trackers in other apps, not just the trackers we find on websites when you browse. These dual layers of protection reduce what companies know about you overall, so you can use your apps with more peace of mind, knowing youâ€™re more protected.
Keep using your device. Tracking attempts that Device Shield blocks appear here.
You\'re a beta tester. Notice a problem with your apps? Report Issues
Device Shield is disabled\nDid Device Shield cause a problem with your apps? Report Issues
What trackers does Device Shield block?

Device Shield blocks known trackers that it identifies from third-party companies, or those different from the company that owns each app. For example, if Facebook owns the app, Device Shield doesnâ€™t block its trackers, but would block trackers from Google or Amazon. Weâ€™re always on the lookout for other trackers for Device Shield to block.\n\nSome apps and known trackers might be excluded automatically based on whether theyâ€™d work properly with Device Shield enabled.
Why does Device Shield use a VPN connection?

Youâ€™ll be asked to set up a virtual private network (VPN) connection, but you don\'t need to install a VPN app for Device Shield to work.\n\nThis permission, which works only on your device, allows Device Shield to monitor network traffic so that it can block known trackers.
How is Device Shield different from a VPN?

A VPN sends your data from the device to its own server, where it secures and anonymizes your data from prying eyes. However, this allows the VPN company to see your network traffic.

Device Shield is different. Instead of sending your data to a VPN server, Device Shield works only on your device, sitting between your apps and the servers they talk to.

Whenever Device Shield recognizes a known tracker, it blocks the tracker from sending personal information (such as your IP address, activity, and device details) off your device. All other traffic reaches its destination, so your apps work normally.
Device Shield works only on your device and doesnâ€™t send your data off your device to DuckDuckGo. We donâ€™t collect or store any data from your apps.
